txt.en: 'DNT - Blah!'

'Do you understand, [placeholder]? It is not needless cruelty that drove this tale of mine. No, it is kindness. For my words wove a picture of the fate that awaits us all. It cannot be avoided. Better to accept the road and set our affairs in order than to fight it fruitlessly. In fewer than three hours it will be the fourteenth of March. We are unlikely to live until dawn on the fifteenth!'

You shake your head to clear it, but still your mind is foggy. Is it really only half past nine in the evening of the thirteenth of March? The account seemed so vivid, so real...

Your eyes turn toward the palant√≠r. Denethor laughs, but there is no humour in it.

'I have wrestled with the seeing-stone for many days, [placeholder]. I am not surprised that the experience left you feeling unwell, and particularly susceptible to the words I spoke. Can you not see how the tale I spun you must surely follow from the images you beheld in the stone? The end has come. The end has come! The armies have not yet surrounded Minas Tirith, but they will. The folk have not yet thrown in with the Withered Tree, but they will! Grond has not yet come to the gates, but it will! How long can they stand against that ram? If they last even a minute longer than I believe, that will be a triumph. But it will not matter. All that I have told you will come to pass.'

You try to tell the Steward that he is wrong, but you cannot find the words.

'You have seen what I saw in the stone. Hirgon and the Red Arrow did not make it to Rohan, and the foolish one Mithrandir sent to Mordor is a captive in Cirith Ungol! Yes, I know of that errand. And I know it has failed! Whatever that fool brought with him is now gone, and if it is the weapon I perceive, it will not matter if the gates of Minas Tirith last five minutes or five hours. The end will come! It has already come!

'Go, [placeholder]! Go and die! Every person in this city will follow you soon!'
You have hurried down to the ruin of the gates with Mithrandir. Only he can stand against the Witch-king.
'Father! Duilin!'
DNT - Blah!
You must find Peregrin Took and protect him from the forces of the Enemy!
Talk to Gothmog atop the city

'Stay back, [placeholder]. You have become mighty indeed during your adventures, but the evil that now stands in the ruin of the gate is beyond your measure. Only I can stand against the Witch-king now.'
DNT - Blah!
Gondor's darkest hour has come. The forces of Mordor have broken the gates of Minas Tirith, and the Witch-king of Angmar has brought his master's evil to bear upon the defenders of the White City.
DNT - Blah!
Fight alongside Denethor atop the city
Imrahil has slain many Orcs, and has called to you for news of the gate.
Talk to Denethor before he succumbs to his wounds
'[placeholder], look out!'
'[placeholder]!'
'What news, [placeholder]? I heard shouts of terror and dismay, but could not find what caused them!'\n\nBefore you can say a word, his eyes widen in surprise.
Remain alert for any chance to help Peregrin or Denethor!
Talk to Denethor amid the terrible visions
You have been captured by the Enemy!
'[placeholder]! This way!'
Denethor has emerged from the tower, ready to die for his city and his people.
'Mithrandir... I cannot believe it!'
DNT - Blah!
Shake off your reverie, and talk to Denethor
'DNT - Blah!'
'We must save the halfling, as he asked!'
Your mind is full of hazy, troubled images
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'Do you at last understand the words I have spoken, [placeholder]? Do you finally see that this doom cannot be avoided?'
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
Escape from the enemy and find Peregrin Took
DNT - Blah!
'How can this be the end for me?'
Escape from the enemy and find Peregrin Took
Talk to Imrahil
Wait for a chance to turn the tables on your captors
'No!'
Denethor is standing before you, his face an earnest mask of despair and hopelessness.
'Fight on, my boys! Do not give up!'
'Do you understand?'
'Mithrandir!'
'With the things I have seen... this must be what will happen.'
Mithrandir stands alone before the Witch-king, blocking his passage into the city.
'This sad fate awaits us. It cannot be avoided!'
Your mind is filled with terrible visions, but the voice of the Steward cuts through the frightening images.
'Go and die, [placeholder]! There can be no avoiding the doom of which I have spoken!'
You must find Peregrin Took and protect him from the forces of the Enemy!
You must find Peregrin Took and protect him from the forces of the Enemy!
Gothmog stands before you at the top of the city, secure in victory.
Remain alert

'And so it ends, [placeholder]. The Wizard is slain, and will trouble my Master no longer. The city is taken!\n\n'What few defenders remain in the city will be rooted out and brought to this high place, and it is here they will die. You live only because I commanded it, but once the last cries of the dying have faded into the wind, you too will follow them.'
Denethor has been wounded.
'[placeholder]... what could... we have done...?'
The Witch-king is victorious!
'Where is the Steward? Find me the pretender!'
'After him!'
'I am here, vermin! I fight for my people!'
'Flee, young Peregrin!'
'My lord!'
'Old fool! This is my hour!'
'Nothing comes for you but Death.'
Talk to Mithrandir before the broken gate
'Die... now...'
'Keep fighting, Golasgil! We have them where we want them!'
'You will not enter here.'
Witness the confrontation between Mithrandir and the Witch-king of Angmar
'Golasgil?'
'Go back to the abyss! It awaits you and your Master!'
'Can you not hear?'
Peregrin Took is in grave danger!
'The dawn is coming, and with it comes Hope!'
'You must... protect... Peregrin...'
Escape from the enemy and find Peregrin Took
Your mind is filled with terrible visions, but the voice of the Steward cuts through the frightening images.
A shrill voice pierces the thin air above the city
Instance: The Darkest Hour
